page.title: 02Population and employment
page.content: The population of the parish is now about 500 having been at a peak of 1,033 in 1851; the village itself has a population of 370, having peaked at 733 in 1851 when most people worked in the village in what must have been a very self-contained community. Now many people from the village work in Berwick, although there are about 25 net fishermen and as many farmworkers in the parish. Children under school leaving age (16) amount to approximately 90 in the parish in a country where the average age of the population is getting older. School leavers find employment in the small factories of Berwick 7 miles away or move to the cities to live and either work or further there studies.
